raw_text: We have presented an ensemble approach to word sense disambiguation (Pedersen, 2000) where multiple Naive Bayesianclassiers, each based on co{ occurrence features from varying sized windows of context, is shown to perform well on the widely studied nouns interest and line
clean_text: We have presented an ensemble approach to word sense disambiguation (Pedersen, 2000) where multiple Naive Bayesian classiers, each based on co-occurrence features from varying sized windows of context, is shown to perform well on the widely studied nouns interest and line.

raw_text: Pedersen (2000) proposed an ensemble model with multiple NBclassifiers differing by context window size
clean_text: Pedersen (2000) proposed an ensemble model with multiple NB classifiers differing by context window size.

raw_text: It is similar to the ordinary Naive Bayes model for WSD (Pedersen, 2000)
clean_text: It is similar to the ordinary Naive Bayes model for WSD (Pedersen, 2000).

raw_text: The origins of Duluth38 can be found in an ensemble approach based on multiple Naive Bayesianclassifiers that perform disambiguation via a majority vote (Pedersen, 2000)
clean_text: The origins of Duluth can be found in an ensemble approach based on multiple Naive Bayesian classifiers that perform disambiguation via a majority vote (Pedersen, 2000).

raw_text: The approach used, called c o m b i n a t i o n approach, has known lots of success in speech recognition (Fiscus 1997, Schwenck and Gauvain 2000), part of speech tagging (Halteren and al. 1998, Brill and al. 1998, Marquez et Padro 1998), named entity recognition (Borthwick and al. 1998), word sense disambiguation (Pedersen, 2000) and recently in parsing (Henderson and Brill 1999), Inui and Inui 2000, Monceaux and Robba 2003)
clean_text: The approach used, called combination approach, has known lots of success in speech recognition (Fiscus 1997, Schwenck and Gauvain 2000), part of speech tagging (Halteren and al. 1998, Brill and al. 1998, Marquez et Padro 1998), named entity recognition (Borthwick and al. 1998), word sense disambiguation (Pedersen, 2000) and recently in parsing (Henderson and Brill 1999), Inui and Inui 2000, Monceaux and Robba 2003).

citing_paper_authors: Jennifer, Chu-Carroll | Krzysztof, Czuba | John, Prager | Abraham, Ittycheriah
raw_text: In NLP, such methods have been applied to tasks such as POS tagging (Brill and Wu, 1998), word sense disambiguation (Pedersen, 2000), parsing (Henderson and Brill, 1999), and machine translation (Frederking and Nirenburg, 1994)
clean_text: In NLP, such methods have been applied to tasks such as POS tagging (Brill and Wu, 1998), word sense disambiguation (Pedersen, 2000), parsing (Henderson and Brill, 1999), and machine translation (Frederking and Nirenburg, 1994).

raw_text: Proceedings of the 40th Annual Meeting of the Association for Voorhess 1998), Winnow (Golding and Roth 1999), Boosting (Escudero et al 2000), and Na ?ve Bayesian Ensemble (Pedersen 2000)
clean_text: They include those using Naive Bayes (Gale et al. 1992a), Decision List (Yarowsky 1994), Nearest Neighbor (Ng and Lee 1996), Transformation Based Learning (Mangu and Brill 1997), Neural Network (Towell and Voorhess 1998), Winnow (Golding and Roth 1999), Boosting (Escudero et al 2000), and Naive Bayesian Ensemble (Pedersen 2000).

raw_text: Among these methods, the one using Na ?ve Bayesian Ensemble (i.e., an ensemble of Na ?ve Bayesian Classifiers) is reported to perform the best for word sense disambiguation with respect to a benchmark data set (Pedersen 2000)
clean_text: Among these methods, the one using Naive Bayesian Ensemble (i.e., an ensemble of Naive Bayesian Classifiers) is reported to perform the best for word sense disambiguation with respect to a benchmark data set (Pedersen 2000).

raw_text: (1) It actually employs an ensemble of the Na ?ve Bayesian Classifiers (NBC), because an ensemble of NBCs generally performs better than a single NBC (Pedersen 2000)
clean_text: It actually employs an ensemble of the Naive Bayesian Classifiers (NBC), because an ensemble of NBCs generally performs better than a single NBC (Pedersen 2000).

raw_text: Table 4 shows the results achieved by some existing supervised learning methods with respect to the benchmark data (cf., Pedersen 2000)
clean_text: Table 4 shows the results achieved by some existing supervised learning methods with respect to the benchmark data (cf., Pedersen 2000).

raw_text: The Duluth-xLSS system was originally inspired by (Pedersen, 2000), which presents an ensemble of eighty-one Naive Bayesian classifiers based on varying sized windows of context to the left and right of the target word that define co-occurrence features
clean_text: The Duluth-xLSS system was originally inspired by (Pedersen, 2000), which presents an ensemble of eighty-one Naive Bayesian classifiers based on varying sized windows of context to the left and right of the target word that define co-occurrence features.

raw_text: Pedersen (2000) built an ensemble of Na ?ve Bayesian classifiers, each of which is based on lexical features that represent co-occurring words in varying sized windows of context
clean_text: Pedersen (2000) built an ensemble of Naive Bayesian classifiers, each of which is based on lexical features that represent co-occurring words in varying sized windows of context.

raw_text: Locally weighted NB (LWNB, Frank et al 2003) and Ensemble NB (ENB Pedersen 2000) are two combinational approaches
clean_text: Locally weighted NB (LWNB, Frank et al 2003) and Ensemble NB (ENB Pedersen 2000) are two combinational approaches.

raw_text: Stevenson and Wilks (2001) presented a classifier combination framework where 3 disambiguation methods (simulated annealing, subject codes and selectional restrictions) were combined using the TiMBL memory-based approach (Daelemans et al, 1999) .Pedersen (2000) presents experiments with an ensemble of Na ?ve Bayes classifiers, which outperform all previous published results on two ambiguous words (line and interest)
clean_text: Pedersen (2000) presents experiments with an ensemble of Naive Bayes classifiers, which outperform all previous published results on two ambiguous words (line and interest).
